p.s: In the article Is the usefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights coming to an end? The answer is yes the author Brian Pollard states that [...] in the twenty-first century the situation has changed, workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employees.
In my opinion this statement is only partly correct and the author is only right to a certain degree.
It may be true that unions are in some cases less benefitial than harmful but in most cases all around the world workers are still mistreated and exploited.
Mr. Pollard's statmentstatement that employers are exploited may be right for workers that work under unions or workers in a country with laws against the mistreatment of workers.
But many workers around the world would greatly benefit from working under a union and they need to be helped.
Just because a few workers are exploiting the plan in the concept of unions doesn't mean that all other workers aren't dependent on this help.
In class we learned that workers in bangladeshBangladesh have to run into buildings that are lit on fire to get labels for their products because without the labels they would sell for much less.
And this is a perfect example of why unions aren't exploited but they are needed to prevent such a dangerous accident.
All of this summarized means that unions might be exploited and a problem for employers but for employees it is a much bigger problem to work without a union.
